en.item_desc_pg:
An instrument for measuring underwater pressure.
Returns values in atm units, where 1 atm = the atmospheric pressure at sea level.
en.item_desc_dg:
An instrument for measuring underwater depth.
Measures pressure then calculates depth using their linear relationship. Returns values in meters.
en.item_desc_th:
A device for measuring water temperature.
Returns values in Celsius.
en.desc_shell:
A large sea snail with a horn-shaped shell.
There is something mysterious about this one...
en.desc_otter:
A cute marine mammal with thick fur.
Can live on land and in water.
en.radio_no-signal: There is no signal here... maybe I should try again above water.
en.radio_signal-lost: Weird... lost the signal. Just when I was about to report something interesting.
en.intro_1: There is a place in the ocean called the Triton's Triangle...
en.intro_2: Known for stories about lurking sea monsters and strange forces.
en.intro_3: Yet, despite the danger, many still venture there. Why?
en.intro_4: Because of a legend of something hidden deep below:
en.intro_5: a treasure of unimaginable value and beauty.
en.pl_1: Years ago, a crew of treasure hunters ventured into the Triangle.
en.pl_2: They brought heavy machinery and disrupted many habitats.
en.pl_3: Whether they found the treasure or not, no one knows.
en.pl_4: Because the entire crew vanished without a trace...
en.brief-1: SM-Explorer, this is Mission Control. Just checking in - how's everything looking there?
en.brief-1_o1: Looking good so far. No sea monsters yet, so I'd call that a win.
en.brief-1_o1-1: Well, letâ€™s hope it stays that way once you start your dive.
en.brief-1_o2: Its beautiful here. Doesn't seem very dangerous right now.
en.brief-1_o2-1: Glad to hear it. Stay alert though, we don't really know what lies deep below.
en.brief-1_o3: Honestly, it's a little too quiet. This place makes me nervous...
en.brief-1_o3-1: That's understandable. We'll keep a close watch on your readings from here.
en.brief-2: Your mission is to investigate the depths of the Triton's Triangle and gather valuable data.
en.brief-2_o1: Tell me more about this place.
en.brief-2_o1-1: To be honest, we don't know much... this ocean region is mostly uncharted.
en.brief-2_o1-2: Years ago, there was a mining expedition but the crew all went missing...
en.brief-2_o1-3: The only data we retrieved were some strange temperature readings from deep below.
en.brief-2_o1-3_o1-1: A temperature anomaly. Warm temperatures, at very deep depths.
en.brief-2_o1-3_o1-2: Which is unusual because generally the deep ocean is very cold.
en.brief-2_o2: How should I approach the mission?
en.brief-2_o2-1: Once you dive down, do some exploring and try to find anything interesting.
en.brief-2_o2-2: I recommend using the Scientific Method to guide your exploration.
en.brief-2_o2-2_o1-1: The Scientific Method is a process that scientists follow to learn about the world around us.
en.brief-2_o2-3: A diagram of the Scientific Method is available in your inventory whenever you need a refresher.
en.brief-3: Start exploring whenever you're ready. Don't forget to check your equipment first.
en.brief-4: Don't hesitate to radio in if you have any questions. Good luck, SM-Explorer.
en.hint-1: Signal received SM-Explorer. What is your status?
en.hint-1_o1-default: All good here. Just saying hi.
en.hint-1_o1-default-1: Good to hear from you. Feel free to radio in whenever you need.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1: These are dangerous waters. Turn back now, for your own good.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1_o1: What?! A talking shell! That is so cool.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-1_o1-1: Hey, are you even listening? ...and don't call me a shell.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-2: Many treasure hunters have come, and never returned to their families.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3: Trust me. Leave now while you still can.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o1: Ok, but I will be back.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2: I can't leave now. Not until I complete my mission.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-1: I'm not a treasure hunter. I'm an ocean explorer... and a scientist.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-2: I'm here to explore the depths of this place, and find out what happened to my dad.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-4: My dad was a scientist. He came here years ago and went missing.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-6: I see... I'm sorry about your dad...
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-7: Listen kid, I want to help you... but I need to know if you can handle the depths.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-3_o2-8: Prove to me that you are really a scientist.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-4: Start with the first step of the Scientific Method: Observation.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-5: Come back once you have recorded 3 observations about things that change with depth.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-5_o1-1: Explore both shallow and deep depths, try to observe any changes and record them.
en.ch1_observations-1: It is much brighter at the surface than at the bottom.
en.ch1_observations-2: The color of the ocean changes the deeper I go.
en.ch1_observations-3: It gets much harder to see at the bottom.
en.ch1_observations-record: I need something to record this observation with though.
en.ch1_conch-review-1: Let me see what you have here.
en.ch1_conch-review-2: Not bad. Now what could be a scientific question I could ask based on these observations?
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q1: Why is the deep ocean so dark?
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q1-1: Good start, but it needs to be more specific.
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q1-2: Try using variables in your question: the things that you observe changing.
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q2: How does color of the ocean change with depth?
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q2-1: Much better, but color can sometimes be subjective.
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q2-2: Hmm, if we used a different variable, something less subjective...
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q3: How about the amount of sunlight?
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q3-1: Yes, that works! How does the amount of sunlight change with depth in the ocean?
en.ch1_conch-review-2_q3-2: Now that is a question that relates to your observations, is specific, and can be measured.
en.ch1_conch-review-4: These are examples of qualitative data: descriptions about things that are observed, but not measured precisely.
en.ch1_conch-encounter-5_o3-1: Qualitative data are descriptions about things that are observed, but not measured precisely.
